metadata.title: CVE-2016-8864 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
named in ISC BIND 9.x before 9.9.9-P4, 9.10.x before 9.10.4-P4, and 9.11.xbefore 9.11.0-P1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(assertion failure and daemon exit) via a DNAME record in the answersection of a response to a recursive query, related to db.c and resolver.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8864` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2
bind9-host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2
bind9utils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2
dnsutils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2
host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2
libbind9-140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2
libdns-export162 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2
libdns162 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2
libirs-export141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2
libirs141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2
libisc-export160 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2
libisc160 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2
libisccc-export140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2
libisccc140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2
libisccfg-export140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2
libisccfg140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2
liblwres141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2
lwresd - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.2').
